title: Intro
body: A full stack developer is responsible for both sides of the process. Those two sides are client and server. A client is a person (or robot) requesting information. Hence, it is called a "request". The other side of the agreement is the "server", which is responsible for responding to the requestor, hence known as a 'request-response' lifecycle.

title: Version 1
body: The easiest way to start is to have static data. In this first demo, the data (these words) are already prepared on teh client. The reality is they are not.
